briefdescription.para: Set the advertising or scan response data to the given data.

parameterdescription.para: Length of the data. Maximum length is 236 bytes.

briefdescription.para: Start advertising using the given advertising set and duration.

parameterdescription.para: Number of advertising sets to enable.
Maximum number of extended advertising events array.

briefdescription.para: Stop advertising for the given advertising set. If the number of sets is set to 0 then all advertising sets are disabled.

parameterdescription.para: Number of advertising sets to disable.

briefdescription.para: Remove an advertising set.
Clear advertising sets.
Set the random device address for a given advertising set.
Set the minimum and maximum advertising intervals.
Include or exclude certain channels from the advertising channel map.
Set the local address type used while advertising. This function can be used to configure advertising to use a random address.

memberdef.name: DmAdvSetAdValue

briefdescription.para: Set the value of an advertising data element in the given advertising or scan response data. If the element already exists in the data then it is replaced with the new value. If the element does not exist in the data it is appended to it, space permitting.

parameterdescription.para: Length of the value. Maximum length is 29 bytes.
Advertising or scan response data length. The new length is returned in this parameter.
Pointer to advertising or scan response data.
Length of the advertising or scan response data buffer maintained by Application.

simplesect.para: true if the element was successfully added to the data, false otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t len, uint8_t *pValue, uint16_t *pAdvDataLen, uint8_t *pAdvData, uint16_t advDataBufLen)
memberdef.name: DmAdvSetName

briefdescription.para: Set the device name in the given advertising or scan response data. If the name can only fit in the data if it is shortened, the name is shortened and the AD type is changed to DM_ADV_TYPE_SHORT_NAME.

parameterdescription.para: Length of the name. Maximum length is 29 bytes.
Pointer to the name in UTF-8 format.
Advertising or scan response data length. The new length is returned in this parameter.
Pointer to advertising or scan response data.
Length of the advertising or scan response data buffer maintained by Application.

simplesect.para: true if the element was successfully added to the data, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Set subevent data in response to the DM_PER_ADV_SUB_EVT_DATA_REQ_IND event.

description.para: Functions for controlling Privacy.

briefdescription.para: Initialize DM privacy module.

Resolve a private resolvable address. When complete the client's callback function is called with a DM_PRIV_RESOLVED_ADDR_IND event. The client must wait to receive this event before executing this function again.

parameterdescription.para: Client-defined parameter returned with callback event.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t addrType, const uint8_t *pIdentityAddr, uint8_t *pPeerIrk, uint8_t *pLocalIrk, bool enableLlPriv, uint16_t param)
memberdef.name: DmPrivAddDevToResList

briefdescription.para: Add device to resolving list. When complete the client's callback function is called with a DM_PRIV_ADD_DEV_TO_RES_LIST_IND event. The client must wait to receive this event before executing this function again.

parameterdescription.para: Set to true to enable address resolution in LL.
client-defined parameter returned with callback event.

simplesect.para:
This command cannot be used when address resolution is enabled in the Controller and:
Advertising (other than periodic advertising) is enabled,
Scanning is enabled, or
(Extended) Create connection or Create Sync command is outstanding.
If the local or peer IRK associated with the peer Identity Address is all zeros then the Controller will use or accept the local or peer Identity Address respectively.
Parameter 'enableLlPriv' should be set to true when the last device is being added to resolving list to enable address resolution in the Controller.

briefdescription.para: Remove device from resolving list. When complete the client's callback function is called with a DM_PRIV_REM_DEV_FROM_RES_LIST_IND event. The client must wait to receive this event before executing this function again.

parameterdescription.para: client-defined parameter returned with callback event.

simplesect.para:
This command cannot be used when address resolution is enabled in the Controller and:
Advertising (other than periodic advertising) is enabled,
Scanning is enabled, or
(Extended) Create connection or Create Sync command is outstanding.

briefdescription.para: Clear resolving list. When complete the client's callback function is called with a DM_PRIV_CLEAR_RES_LIST_IND event. The client must wait to receive this event before executing this function again.

simplesect.para:
This command cannot be used when address resolution is enabled in the Controller and:
Advertising (other than periodic advertising) is enabled,
Scanning is enabled, or
(Extended) Create connection or Create Sync command is outstanding.
Address resolution in Controller will be disabled when resolving list's cleared successfully.

briefdescription.para: HCI read peer resolvable address command. When complete the client's callback function is called with a DM_PRIV_READ_PEER_RES_ADDR_IND event. The client must wait to receive this event before executing this function again.

Read local resolvable address command. When complete the client's callback function is called with a DM_PRIV_READ_LOCAL_RES_ADDR_IND event. The client must wait to receive this event before executing this function again.

Enable or disable address resolution in LL. When complete the client's callback function is called with a DM_PRIV_SET_ADDR_RES_ENABLE_IND event. The client must wait to receive this event before executing this function again.

parameterdescription.para: Set to true to enable address resolution or false to disable it.

simplesect.para:
This command can be used at any time except when:
Advertising (other than periodic advertising) is enabled,
Scanning is enabled, or
(Extended) Create connection or Create Sync command is outstanding.

briefdescription.para: Set resolvable private address timeout command.
Set privacy mode for a given entry in the resolving list.

parameterdescription.para: Privacy mode (by default, network privacy mode is used).

simplesect.para:
This command can be used at any time except when:
Advertising (other than periodic advertising) is enabled,
Scanning is enabled, or
(Extended) Create connection or Create Sync command is outstanding.

briefdescription.para: Generate a Resolvable Private Address (RPA).

parameterdescription.para: Client-defined parameter returned with callback event.

briefdescription.para: Specify circumstances when the Controller should refresh any RPA used by the advertising set identified by the advHandle parameter, whether or not the address timeout period has been reached.
Whether LL Privacy is enabled.

simplesect.para: true if LL Privacy is enabled. false, otherwise.

description.para: Functions for controlling Legacy and Extended Scanner behavior.

briefdescription.para: Initialize DM legacy scanning.

Initialize DM Connection Constant Tone Extension (CTE) module.

simplesect.para: true if DM scanning is in legacy mode. false, otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Whether DM scanning is in extended mode.

simplesect.para: true if DM scanning is in extended mode. false, otherwise.

memberdef.name: DmScanStart

briefdescription.para: Start scanning on the given PHYs.

parameterdescription.para: Filter duplicates. Set to true to filter duplicate responses received from the same device. Set to false to receive all responses.
The scan duration, in milliseconds. If set to zero or both duration and period set to non-zero, scanning will continue until DmScanStop() is called.
The scan period, in 1.28 sec units (only applicable to AE). If set to zero, periodic scanning is disabled.

briefdescription.para: Stop scanning.
Set the scan interval and window for the specified PHYs.
Set the local address type used while scanning. This function can be used to configure scanning to use a random address.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t advSid, uint8_t advAddrType, const uint8_t *pAdvAddr, uint16_t skip, uint16_t syncTimeout, uint8_t syncCteType)
memberdef.name: DmSyncStart

briefdescription.para: Synchronize with periodic advertising from the given advertiser, and start receiving periodic advertising packets.

detaileddescription.para: Note: The synchronization filter policy is used to determine whether the periodic advertiser list is used. If the periodic advertiser list is not used, the advertising SID, advertiser address type, and advertiser address parameters specify the periodic advertising device to listen to; otherwise these parameters are ignored.

parameterdescription.para: Number of periodic advertising packets that can be skipped after successful receive.
Synchronization timeout, in the units of 10ms.
Whether to only synchronize to periodic advertising with certain types of Constant Tone Extension (0 indicates that the presence or absence of a Constant Tone Extension is irrelevant).

briefdescription.para: Stop reception of the periodic advertising identified by the given sync identifier.
Set the encryption mode of the Broadcast Isochronous Group (BIG) corresponding to the periodic advertising train identified by the sync handle.
Get the encryption mode of the Broadcast Isochronous Group (BIG) corresponding to the periodic advertising train identified by the sync handle.

simplesect.para: true if sync encrypted. false, otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get status of sync identified by the handle.

simplesect.para: true if sync is enabled for that handle. false, otherwise.

Identifies subevent for the periodic advertising packet that the Host is responding to.

Identifies subevent for the periodic advertising packet that the Host is responding to.

simplesect.para: true if response data was set. false, otherwise.

memberdef.name: DmBigSyncStart

briefdescription.para: Synchronize to a Broadcast Isochronous Group (BIG) described in the periodic advertising train specified by the sync handle.

parameterdescription.para: Synchronization timeout for the BIS, in the units of 10ms.
Total number of BISes in the BIG.
List of indices of BISes (in ascending order).

briefdescription.para: Stop synchronizing or cancel the process of synchronizing to the Broadcast Isochronous Group (BIG) identified by the handle.

simplesect.para: The command also terminates the reception of BISes in the BIG specified in DmBigSyncStart, destroys the associated connection handles of the BISes in the BIG and removes the data paths for all BISes in the BIG.

briefdescription.para: For internal use only. Return true if the BIS sync is in use.

simplesect.para: true if the BIS sync is in use, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Update the connection parameters of an open connection.

briefdescription.para: Read RSSI of a given connection.
Reply to the HCI remote connection parameter request event. This command is used to indicate that the Host has accepted the remote device's request to change connection parameters.

Request a change to the subrating factor and other parameters applied to the specified connection.

description.para: Functions for forming and managing Connected Isochronous Stream (CIS) streams.

briefdescription.para: Initialize DM Connected Isochronous Stream (CIS) manager.
Initialize DM Connected Isochronous Stream (CIS) manager for operation as master.
Initialize DM Connected Isochronous Stream (CIS) manager for operation as slave.
Set the interval, in microseconds, of periodic SDUs for the given Connected Isochronous Group (CIG).

parameterdescription.para: Time interval between start of consecutive SDUs from master Host.
Time interval between start of consecutive SDUs from slave Host.

briefdescription.para: Set the slaves clock accuracy for the given Connected Isochronous Group (CIG).

simplesect.para: The slaves clock accuracy must which must be the worst-case sleep clock accuracy of the slaves that will participate in the CIG.

briefdescription.para: Set the packing scheme and framing format for the given Connected Isochronous Group (CIG).

parameterdescription.para: Indicates format of CIS Data PDUs.

briefdescription.para: Set the maximum transport latency, in microseconds, for the given Connected Isochronous Group (CIG).

parameterdescription.para: Maximum time for SDU to be transported from master Controller to slave Controller.
Maximum time for SDU to be transported from slave Controller to master Controller.

briefdescription.para: Set the parameters of one or more Connected Isochronous Streams (CISes) that are associated with the given Connected Isochronous Group (CIG).

parameterdescription.para: Number of CIS to be configured.

briefdescription.para: Remove all the Connected Isochronous Streams (CISes) associated with the given Connected Isochronous Group (CIG).
Create one or more Connected Isochronous Streams (CISes) using the connections identified by the ACL connection handles.

parameterdescription.para: Total number of CISes to be created.
List of connection handles of CISes.

briefdescription.para: Inform the Controller to accept the request for the Connected Isochronous Stream (CIS) that is identified by the connection handle.
Inform the Controller to reject the request for the Connected Isochronous Stream (CIS) that is identified by the connection handle.

parameterdescription.para: Connection handle of the CIS to be rejected.
Reason the CIS request was rejected.

briefdescription.para: Close the Connected Isochronous Stream (CIS) connection with the given handle.
For internal use only. Find the Connected Isochronous Stream (CIS) ID with matching handle.

simplesect.para: CIS identifier or DM_CIS_ID_NONE if error.

briefdescription.para: For internal use only. Find the Connected Isochronous Stream (CIS) handle with matching CIG and CIS identifiers.

simplesect.para: CIS connection handle or DM_CONN_HCI_HANDLE_NONE if error.

briefdescription.para: For internal use only. Return true if the Connected Isochronous Stream (CIS) connection is in use.

simplesect.para: true if the CIS connection is in use, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: For internal use only. Return the CIS connection role indicating master or slave.
For internal use only. Return true if Connected Isochronous Group (CIG) is in use.

simplesect.para: true if CIG is in use, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: For internal use only. Return true if the Connected Isochronous Stream (CIS) connection is in use.

simplesect.para: true if the CIS connection is in use, false otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: Parameters for reading local supported controller delay.

description.para: Device control functions

briefdescription.para: Reset the device.
Set the random address to be used by the local device.
Add a peer device to the white list. Note that this function cannot be called while advertising, scanning, or connecting with white list filtering active.
Remove a peer device from the white list. Note that this function cannot be called while advertising, scanning, or connecting with white list filtering active.
Clear the white list. Note that this function cannot be called while advertising, scanning, or connecting with white list filtering active.

simplesect.para: true if the filter policy was successfully set, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Set the Advertising filter policy for the given advertising, Scanning or Initiator filter policy.

simplesect.para: true if the filter policy was successfully set, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: This function is called to cancel the pairing process.

parameterdescription.para: Length of PIN or OOB data.
pointer to PIN or OOB data.

briefdescription.para: This function is called by a slave device to request that the master initiates pairing or link encryption.

memberdef.name: DmSecLtkRsp

briefdescription.para: This function is called by a slave in response to a DM_SEC_LTK_REQ_IND event to provide the long term key used for encryption.

parameterdescription.para: Security level of pairing when key was exchanged.
Pointer to the key, if found.

briefdescription.para: This function sets the local CSRK used by the device.
This function sets the local IRK used by the device.
This function sets the local identity address used by the device.
This function generates an ECC key for use with LESC security.
This function sets the ECC key for use with LESC security.
This function gets the local ECC key for use with LESC security.
This function sets the ECC key for use with LESC security to standard debug keys values.
This function configures the DM to use OOB pairing for the given connection. The pRand and pConfirm contain the Random and Confirm values exchanged via out of band methods.

This function calculates the local random and confirm values used in LESC OOB pairing. The operation's result is posted as a DM_SEC_CALC_OOB_IND event to the application's DM callback handler. The local rand and confirm values are exchanged with the peer via out-of-band (OOB) methods and passed into the DmSecSetOob after DM_CONN_OPEN_IND.

parameterdescription.para: X component of the local public key.

briefdescription.para: This function is called by the application in response to a DM_SEC_COMPARE_IND event. The valid parameter indicates if the compare value of the DM_SEC_COMPARE_IND was valid.

parameterdescription.para: true if compare value was valid

briefdescription.para: This function returns the 6-digit compare value for the specified 128-bit confirm value.
